translations: v．重新安置：将某人或某物从一个地方搬到另一个地方，通常是为了提供更好的居住条件或环境。
· The family was rehoused after their home was destroyed in the fire.
在他们的房子被火灾摧毁后，这个家庭得到了重新安置。

phrs.translation: 在修房期间予以安排新住处的房客

sentences.sentence: Thousands of earthquake victims are still waiting to be rehoused.
sentences.translation: 数千名地震灾民仍在等待安排新住处。

sentences.sentence: Some of the residents of the villa say they would welcome being rehoused elsewhere.
sentences.translation: 这里的有一些居民说，他们愿意被安置到别的地方。

sentences.sentence: To date Slough has rehoused four families previously living in sheds; one left Slough and three left Britain.
sentences.translation: 迄今为止Slought已经安置了四户以前住在棚屋的人家，其中一家留在了Slought，其余三家离开了英国。
